trans-unit.source: Represents the lengths of elements within the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> class with an absolute value in pixels.
The absolute pixel value (96 pixels-per-inch) to initialize the length to.
pixels is , , or .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> class with a specified value and unit.
The requested size of the element.
The type that is used to determine how the size of the element is calculated.
value is , , or .
-or-
type is not , , , , or .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> class with the specified value, unit, desired value, and display value.
The requested size of the element.
The type that is used to determine how the size of the element is calculated.
The calculated size needed for the element.
The allocated size for the element.
value is , , or .
-or-
type is not , , , , or .
-or-
desiredValue is or .
-or-
displayValue is or .
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> structure that represents the standard automatic sizing mode.
The standard automatic sizing mode sizes <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> columns based on the contents of both cells and column headers.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> structure that represents the standard automatic sizing mode.
Gets the calculated pixel value needed for the element.
The number of pixels calculated for the size of the element.
Gets the pixel value allocated for the size of the element.
The number of pixels allocated for the element.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref>.
The object to compare to the current instance.

`true` if the specified object is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> with the same value or sizing mode as the current <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> to compare to the current instance.

`true` if the specified object is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> with the same value or sizing mode as the current <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a hash code for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref>.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether this instance sizes elements based on a fixed pixel value.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLengthUnitType.Pixel"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on both the content of cells and the column headers.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLengthUnitType.Auto"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on the content of the cells.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLengthUnitType.SizeToCells"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on the header.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLengthUnitType.SizeToHeader"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this instance automatically sizes elements based on a weighted proportion of available space.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLengthUnitType.Star"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> structures for equality.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> instance to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> instance to compare.
`true` if the two <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> instances have the same value or sizing mode; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> structures to determine whether they are not equal.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> instance to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> instance to compare.
`true` if the two <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> instances do not have the same value or sizing mode; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> structure that represents the cell-based automatic sizing mode.
The cell-based automatic sizing mode sizes <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> columns based on the contents of cells in the column, not including column headers.
This sizing mode will cause columns to expand if content that is larger than the current column size is scrolled into view.
The column will not shrink after the content is scrolled out of view.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> structure that represents the cell-based automatic sizing mode.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> structure that represents the header-based automatic sizing mode.
The header-based automatic sizing mode sizes <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> columns based on the contents of column headers only.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> structure that represents the header-based automatic sizing mode.
Returns a string that represents the current object.
A string that represent the current object.
Gets the type that is used to determine how the size of the element is calculated.
A type that represents how size is determined.
Gets the absolute value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> in pixels.

The absolute value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength"></xref> in pixels, or 1.0 if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLength.UnitType"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridLengthUnitType.Auto"></xref>.
